required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Regorafenib Plus PD-1 Inhibitor in Patients With Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Regorafenib Plus PD-1 Inhibitor as Third-line Therapy in Advanced Colorectal Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study is intended to evaluate efficacy and safety of the combination of regorafenib and nivolumab as third-line or later therapy in patients with microsatellite stable (MSS) colorectal cancer (CRC).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria through study completion, an average of 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with reduction in tumor burden of a predefined amount, including complete remission and partial remission.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria until first documented progress through study completion, an average of 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Time from treatment beginning until disease progression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of treatment beginning until the date of death from any cause, through study completion, an average of 1 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment beginning until death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 months

arm_group.description: All colorectal cancer patients received regorafenib plus PD-1 inhibitor

intervention.description: All Colorectal cancer patients received regorafenib (80mg qd d1-d21,q4w) and PD-1 inhibitor. The patients could receive one type of PD-1 inhibitors according to oneself circumstance consideration including nivolumab (3mg/kg, ivgtt, q2w), Carelizumab (200mg, ivgtt, q3w), Sintilimab (200mg, ivgtt, q3w), Toripalimab(240mg ivgtt, q3w).

facility.name: Department of Medical Oncology, Shanghai Changzheng Hospital
